AD_Guest_004.synopsis: AD for Griska in the Flophouse

Guest_001.synopsis: One-liner with an adventurer in Flophouse.Naive, don't have any real experience, but read a lot of fiction books about adventurers.
Guest_001.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Go To Region - Act 3 Wyrm's Crossing - FlophouseTalk to the adventurer on the ground floor.

Mother_Dead.synopsis: SwD with Fionn Goldgrind, the mother of the serial killer

PAD_BloodiedFlowerKeyUsed.synopsis: This AD is triggered when you use the Bloodied Flower Key to use the wardrobe in the flophouse to get inside Dolor's lair.
PAD_BloodiedFlowerKeyUsed.how_to_trigger: goto 39; -8; -1012kill the Shifterspick up the bloodied Flower Key from the body one of themgoto -17.449 50.881 82.632click on the Wardrobe

AD_Guest_002.synopsis: One of the two adventurers in the Flophouse.

PAD_KeyMotivesBuilding.synopsis: PAD for Open Hand Temple quest. When players get the key to be used in the Flophouse at Wyrm's Crossing, but they don't know for sure, this AD will sound when they are near the Flophouse to link the key with the building itselfs.
PAD_KeyMotivesBuilding.how_to_trigger: Start the open hand temple quest, get the key S_WYR_OpenHand_ShiftersFlowerKey_8ab130ef-4fad-4bfe-b667-f4a73c1c36c0 and then enter in this trigger S_WYR_Flophouse_FlowerTrigger_c93fb7b7-9807-4b72-b9a7-71ca9f79e524

Blood.synopsis: The player clicks on a bloody spot near Dolor's bed. Investigating the blood leads to the player discovering a body underneath the bed. The player can pull out the body from the bed then.

PAD_Vials.synopsis: The player sees some vials in front of them. The dialog happens when you click on them.

PAD_FlowerKey.synopsis: VB when the player picks up a flower key in the flophouse after taking the bloody flower key from the shapeshifter's body in the Open Hand Temple.
PAD_FlowerKey.how_to_trigger: goto 37; -8; -1013kill the shifters, pick up the bloodied flower key from the body of one of themgoto -13; 43; 78pick up a flower key

Guest_004.synopsis: One-liner with a tiefling in the Flophouse.
Guest_004.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Go To Region - Act 3 Wyrm's Crossing - FlophouseTalk to the tiefling on the first floor.

Cook.synopsis: Flophouse cook. Very sweet, very daft. You can discover the landlord is missing from her.

PAD_TemplePlans.synopsis: This dialog is triggered when you click on some plans on Dolor's desk. These are plans of the Open Hand temple. If you've been there before you recognise then, otherwise you say it looks like some temple.

Guest_003.synopsis: One-liner with a worker in the Flophouse.
Guest_003.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Go To Region - Act 3 Wyrm's Crossing - FlophouseTalk to the worker on the first floor.

PAD_Blood.synopsis: AD which is played when the player spots blood near the bed.
PAD_Blood.how_to_trigger: goto -12; 50; 75succeed on a passive perception check

Janitor.synopsis: Flophouse janitor, halfling, should speak like he's got lots going on, slightly high strung. You can ask about the missing people.
Janitor.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_AClick on Dashkent Moliver - S_WYR_Flophouse_Janitor baa78148-4111-47f3-ae72-502a3818fa75 - (-22; 42; 75)

Guest_002.synopsis: One-liner with an adventurer in Flophouse.She always wanted to become an adventurer, trained a lot for it and is eager for action.Her sister wrote her a letter - WYR_Flophouse_LetterToAdventurer which can be found on the second floor.
Guest_002.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Go To Region - Act 3 Wyrm's Crossing - FlophouseTalk to the adventurer on the ground floor.

AD_Guest_004_0.speaker: Traveller Griska
AD_Guest_004_0.text: Maybe the circus would be more open to traders...

AD_Guest_004_1.speaker: Traveller Griska
AD_Guest_004_1.text: You'd think a bunch of 'martyrs' would be happy to see a trader.

AD_Guest_004_2.speaker: Traveller Griska
AD_Guest_004_2.text: I can't believe I got kicked out of a temple.

AD_Guest_004_3.speaker: Traveller Griska
AD_Guest_004_3.text: 'God of the oppressed' my eye. Damn priests.

Guest_001_1.speaker: Adventurer Drim
Guest_001_1.text: Bloody ages we spent hiking from Murann, and they won't let us in the city proper? Bollocks - we're adventurers, DAMN IT!

Guest_001_2.speaker: Player
Guest_001_2.text: Why won't they let you in?

Guest_001_12.speaker: Player
Guest_001_12.text: 'Adventurer' means nothing here anymore. No respect.

Guest_001_14.speaker: Adventurer Drim
Guest_001_14.text: You're damn right - I can't believe they wouldn't let us in.

Guest_001_5.speaker: Player
Guest_001_5.text: Sounds like someone forgot their paperwork.

Guest_001_9.speaker: Adventurer Drim
Guest_001_9.text: Oi, that's not right at all!

Guest_001_4.speaker: Adventurer Drim
Guest_001_4.text: The bridge guard chatted some shite about a 'coronation', couldn't really make head nor tail of it.

Guest_001_11.speaker: Adventurer Drim
Guest_001_11.text: Oh yeah? But whoever's coronation closed down city access should get special treatment? Shove off, cock.

Guest_001_0.speaker: Player
Guest_001_0.text: There's no respect here - my magic could level this city but I'm treated like a commoner.

Guest_001_7.speaker: Adventurer Drim
Guest_001_7.text: Not even any godsdamned dragons round here to slay. Bet they'd let us in then.

Guest_001_13.speaker: Adventurer Drim
Guest_001_13.text: First it's the coronation, now we've not filed the right entry papers... This place was meant to be a city of heroes, not pissing paperwork.

Mother_Dead_48.speaker: Narrator
Mother_Dead_48.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Mother_Dead_14.speaker: Lae'zel
Mother_Dead_14.text: Chk. A son who spills his own mother's blood is fated to spill plenty more.

Mother_Dead_37.speaker: Shadowheart
Mother_Dead_37.text: Charming. She mustn't have nursed him enough as a child - or too much.
Mother_Dead_37.context: NodeContext: Somewhat repelled, Reacting to a corpse saying that she was murdered by her son in a Speak with Dead scene

Mother_Dead_41.speaker: Astarion
Mother_Dead_41.text: It's to be expected - some families just don't get along.

Mother_Dead_19.speaker: Wyll
Mother_Dead_19.text: Killed by her own kid? A damn tragedy, that.

Mother_Dead_38.speaker: Gale
Mother_Dead_38.text: Filial betrayal, is it? A tale as old as the gods themselves.

Mother_Dead_12.speaker: Karlach
Mother_Dead_12.context: NodeContext: talking to a corpse who just said she was murdered by her own son.

Mother_Dead_56.speaker: Halsin
Mother_Dead_56.text: Slain by her own offspring? A perversion of nature.
Mother_Dead_56.context: NodeContext: Somewhat repelled, Reacting to a corpse saying that she was murdered by her son in a Speak with Dead scene

Mother_Dead_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Mother_Dead_6.text: Shameful to be killed by your own son. That honour should fall to a daughter.

Mother_Dead_7.speaker: Player
Mother_Dead_7.text: What were you doing when you died?

Mother_Dead_35.speaker: Ffion Goldgrind
Mother_Dead_35.text: My boy... had a secret... evil secret...

Mother_Dead_20.speaker: Player
Mother_Dead_20.text: Why did your son kill you?

Mother_Dead_17.speaker: Ffion Goldgrind
Mother_Dead_17.text: Found... His secret... My sweet boy... Why...

Mother_Dead_2.speaker: Ffion Goldgrind
Mother_Dead_2.text: Killed... folk... slowly... he liked it...

Mother_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Mother_Dead_1.text: Who was your son's next target?

Mother_Dead_53.speaker: Ffion Goldgrind
Mother_Dead_53.text: Ilmater temple... Didn't see... exactly who...

Mother_Dead_18.speaker: Player
Mother_Dead_18.text: Where can I find your son?

Mother_Dead_11.speaker: Narrator
Mother_Dead_11.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Mother_Dead_54.speaker: Player
Mother_Dead_54.text: What does your son look like?

Mother_Dead_16.speaker: Ffion Goldgrind
Mother_Dead_16.text: Dwarf... Like me... Dresses in... red...

Mother_Dead_55.speaker: Narrator
Mother_Dead_55.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

PAD_BloodiedFlowerKeyUsed_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BloodiedFlowerKeyUsed_0.text: That shapeshifters' key unlocked the door! Interesting.

AD_Guest_002_0.speaker: Adventurer Rosanna
AD_Guest_002_0.text: Stupid bridge guards - should've thumped the lot of them.

AD_Guest_002_1.speaker: Adventurer Rosanna
AD_Guest_002_1.text: How's an adventurer supposed to do her damn job around here?

AD_Guest_002_2.speaker: Adventurer Rosanna
AD_Guest_002_2.text: I can't sit here until the end of bloody time.

AD_Guest_002_3.speaker: Adventurer Rosanna
AD_Guest_002_3.text: Da was right - this was a stupid idea.

PAD_KeyMotivesBuilding_0.speaker: Player
PAD_KeyMotivesBuilding_0.text: I recognise that floral motif - same as that key we found.

Blood_2.speaker: Narrator
Blood_2.text: *The blood you noticed earlier still remains on the floor.*

Blood_3.speaker: Player
Blood_3.text: Try to discern the source of the blood.

Blood_1.speaker: Narrator
Blood_1.text: *You notice the blood's source. A body - hidden under the bed.*

Blood_7.speaker: Narrator
Blood_7.text: *The blood seems to have dried over the course of a few days - you can't make out where it comes from.*

Blood_4.speaker: Player
Blood_4.text: Follow the metallic scent of the blood - track its origin.

Blood_5.speaker: Narrator
Blood_5.text: *You notice some blood has pooled on the wooden floor.*

PAD_Vials_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Vials_0.text: Are those... organs in these vials? Yuck.

PAD_FlowerKey_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FlowerKey_0.text: I know this key - it's identical to the one held by that corpse in the tunnels.

Guest_004_7.speaker: Traveller Griska
Guest_004_7.text: Word to the wise - give that Ilmater temple a wide berth. Rude buggers. Certainly not bringing my trade there again.

Guest_004_6.speaker: Player
Guest_004_6.text: To be fair, their high priest just died.

Guest_004_0.speaker: Traveller Griska
Guest_004_0.text: Does that excuse being rude? Excluding folk? Come off it.

Guest_004_18.speaker: Player
Guest_004_18.text: I thought priests were meant to be polite.

Guest_004_2.speaker: Traveller Griska
Guest_004_2.text: They wouldn't let me in, spouted some tripe about 'my sort' and 'Absolutist murderers' - I only wanted to sit down a minute.

Guest_004_8.speaker: Traveller Griska
Guest_004_8.text: You're welcome. Good luck out there.

Guest_004_13.speaker: Traveller Griska
Guest_004_13.text: This place is real shabby, but at least folk don't look at you funny in here. Need anything?

Guest_004_9.speaker: Player
Guest_004_9.text: Let's see what you have in stock.

Cook_2.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_2.text: Chin up, hon'. I've got just the cure for a rumbling belly.

Cook_8.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_8.text: Blooming hell, you look famished. I got some victuals what'll warm you right up.

Cook_7.speaker: Player
Cook_7.text: I found a dead dwarf hidden away upstairs. She was murdered.

Cook_5.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_5.text: A murder - here? Balduran's biscuits, must've been Ffion. The poor lass - a right good one, she was!

Cook_13.speaker: Player
Cook_13.text: I found Ffion's corpse. Murdered, it seems.

Cook_0.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_0.text: Murdered? Deary me - and to think her remains were just a whisper away!

Cook_12.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_12.text: Make sure Mamzell knows, 'cross the way at the Caress. Ye gods, she'll be right unsettled.

Cook_19.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_19.text: I'm staying put, mind. If a killer wanted me dead, I'd already be crammed under the boards.

Cook_18.speaker: Player
Cook_18.text: I'm feeling a bit peckish. What do you have?

Cook_6.speaker: Player
Cook_6.text: I'm looking for Ffion Goldgrind. What can you tell me about her?

Cook_20.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_20.text: Ffion? Poor lass. Works her arse off for the Mamzell, but don't get much in return.

Cook_17.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_17.text: Not seen her mug for a carp's age. Figure she's gone up road while the going was good.

Cook_1.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_1.text: Killer on the loose. Cult army marchin' wee way. Been thinking I might scarper too.

Cook_9.speaker: Queelia Arvis
Cook_9.text: You look famished, hon'. How about some victuals?

PAD_TemplePlans_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TemplePlans_0.text: These must be the secret tunnels Lorgan was using... His name's written next to them.

PAD_TemplePlans_1.speaker: Player
PAD_TemplePlans_1.text: Tunnels under the Open Hand Temple. The name 'Father Lorgan' is jotted down alongside them.

PAD_TemplePlans_2.speaker: Player
PAD_TemplePlans_2.text: These are tunnels under the Open Hand Temple...  The dead priest's name is written next to them.

PAD_TemplePlans_3.speaker: Player
PAD_TemplePlans_3.text: These tunnels were full of shapeshifters. Father Lorgan's name is written here too.

PAD_TemplePlans_4.speaker: Player
PAD_TemplePlans_4.text: The map shows tunnels beneath a temple. The name 'Father Lorgan' is scrawled alongside them.

Guest_003_7.speaker: Worker Bernyr
Guest_003_7.text: What do you reckon, pal? You trust these Steel Watcher thingymajigs?

Guest_003_4.speaker: Worker Bernyr
Guest_003_4.text: You bonked yer head recently? Didn't spot them by the gate? Big metal bastards, even bigger swords?

Guest_003_6.speaker: Player
Guest_003_6.text: I trust them about as far as I could throw them.

Guest_003_0.speaker: Worker Bernyr
Guest_003_0.text: Aye, do you now? Don't trust the whole thing, meself.

Guest_003_2.speaker: Worker Bernyr
Guest_003_2.text: S'all right while we can get work repairing 'em. But what happens when they build something else to do that? It's no good, I tell you...

Guest_003_8.speaker: Worker Bernyr
Guest_003_8.text: What if they build a machine that can drink pints? Put half the bloody city out of jobs, that.

Janitor_8.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_8.text: Sir, good sir. Give me three days, and -
Janitor_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dashkent not making eye contact, looking at floor and fidgeting, assuming you are someone else - the landlord.

Janitor_29.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_29.text: Oh, erm - apologies. Thought you were someone else. Greetings, so forth, so on.
Janitor_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dashkent makes eye contact with player and realises his mistake.

Janitor_28.speaker: Player
Janitor_28.text: Ffion had a son. Did you two ever meet?

Janitor_25.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_25.text: Dolor? Weird fella. He'd come and go, quiet as a bug's breath.

Janitor_13.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_13.text: Never here when his mum needed him. Always here when she didn't.

Janitor_7.speaker: Player
Janitor_7.text: I found a dwarf's corpse hidden away upstairs. What do you know about it?

Janitor_14.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_14.text: Oh. Oh dear. A dwarf, you say? Ffion, one of Mamzell's girls from Sharess' Caress!

Janitor_2.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_2.text: Been gone for a tenday. Smiled as wide as the Wide, but twice as sunny.

Janitor_31.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_31.text: You don't suppose the murderer - oh goodness no, it's too horrible to imagine!

Janitor_5.speaker: Player
Janitor_5.text: Ffion's been murdered. I found her corpse.

Janitor_17.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_17.text: Oh - oh dear. Poor thing. Murdered to death!

Janitor_19.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_19.text: Horrible Hells, I better lay low. Lower than low. Underlow.

Janitor_26.speaker: Player
Janitor_26.text: What do you know about Ffion Goldgrind?

Janitor_1.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_1.text: Ffion - one of Mamzell's girls! Laughs like a star's twinkle.

Janitor_10.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_10.text: Not seen her for a tenday. Ten days and four bells, to be precise. Not that I'm counting.

Janitor_6.speaker: Player
Janitor_6.text: I'm looking for a killer - a dwarf, dressed in red. Just like you.

Janitor_23.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_23.text: How dare you! Accusing an upstanding citizen like me?
Janitor_23.context: NodeContext: very very hurt, indignant, how DARE the player insinuate this

Janitor_20.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_20.text: Of being a dwarf? I'm a halfling, you oaf!

Janitor_32.speaker: Player
Janitor_32.text: Who did you think I was?

Janitor_16.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_16.text: The landlord, Sir Fraygo Antuna. A most generous soul, I assure you.

Janitor_11.speaker: Player
Janitor_11.text: Ffion has gone missing. Odd, don't you think?

Janitor_3.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_3.text: Missing? I hadn't thought her missing. Just not here, or elsewhere.

Janitor_34.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_34.text: Oh. I suppose that's like 'missing', but with extra words.

Janitor_9.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_9.text: You don't suppose the murderer who's on the loose got hold of her? Oh goodness no, it's too horrible to imagine!

Janitor_24.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_24.text: Gotta keep low. Murderer won't hear a peep out of me.

Janitor_30.speaker: Dashkent Moliver
Janitor_30.text: It is you and most definitely not anyone else! Salutations and hello and whatnot.

Janitor_22.speaker: Player
Janitor_22.text: I am definitely 'me'. Were you expecting someone else?

Guest_002_0.speaker: Adventurer Rosanna
Guest_002_0.text: 'Come to Baldur's Gate', he said. 'Adventurers get welcomed as heroes', he said. Poxy Drim and his bleedin' notions.

Guest_002_1.speaker: Adventurer Rosanna
Guest_002_1.text: This adventurer lark is rubbish. Should've listened to me da. Become a tanner. Bet they're gasping for tanners in Baldur's Gate.
